THE TRAIN CAME BACK TOGETHER WITH THE COUPLER LODGING IN THE WPSX 286TO THE SIDE OF THE DRAWBAR HOUSING. 61007-d-06-10-07-AGCR.Narrative: ON 6-10-07 AT 1925.  DERAILED 2 GONS AT THE SHOEFLY BY SCALE HOUSE CREW PICKED UP 48 MORE CARS OUT OF #5 TRACK WITH 2 UNITS AND 2 LOADED CARS.  THE ENGINEER HAD A FRONT BACK SENT TO WORK WITH, BUT CHOSE TO RUN OFF THE WEST FACING UNIT AGAINST THE CARS.  UP CREW PREVIOUSLY PULLED OUT SOME LIGHT PWR WITHOUT NOTIFYING ANYONE AT AGCR. WHEN THE ENGINEER PULLED OUT THE 50 CARS HE DIDN'T SEE THAT THE EAST END SHOEFLY SWITCH WAS AGAINST HIM.  ENGINEER RUNS SWITCH WITHOUT KNOWING.  THE GROUND MAN STOPS ENGINEER WHEN HE CLEARS THE #5 SWITCH AND TELLS HIM TO SHOVE THE CARS INTO #3 TRACK.  THE GOUNDMAN CAN'T SEE THE SHOEFLY SWITCH SINCE HE IS SEVERAL THOUSAND FEET AWAY.  ENGINEER BRINGS TRAIN TO STOP WHEN NOTICES THE DERAILMENT TAKING  PLACE IN FRONT OF HIM SINCE HE IS ON THE FACING UNIT. 2 CARS ON THE GROUND AND EDI TAG READER TAKEN OUT WITH DERAILMENT. WHEN WE WERE UNSUCCESSFUL IN RERAIL CARS ON OUR OWN.

THE ENGINEER OF THE QNPAS 06 WAS APPLYING AND RELEASING THE LOCOMOTIVE DYNAMIC BRAKES AS THEY PROCEEDED DOWN THE HILL AND INTO TRACK 8.  APPROXIMATELY 12 CAR LENGTHSINTO THE TRACK, THE ENGINEER WENT FROM ZERO DYNAMIC BRAKE TO 92% DYNAMIC CAUSING BUFF FORCE AND LIFTING UP 354954 FROM THE RAIL.  AS A RESULT, FOUR CARS DERAILED.

201935-d-06-06-07-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN 198 DERAILED 6 AUTO RACKS AT THE STRIP ON PB5 UNDER THE 294 TOLLWAY OVERPASS.  198 HAD PULLEDINTO PB5 WITH PERMISSION TO USE 6 LEAD TO CUT REAR CARS OF TRAIN. MAN ON GROUND WAITED FOR SOUTHSIDEJOB TO CLEAR 5 LEAD THEN PULLED OUT 6 LEAD. MOVEMENT WAS STOPPED TO CUT ROAD CROSSING. WENT TO REARTO SEE IF THERE WAS ROOM TO SHOVE. RETURNED INDICATING 6-7 CAR LENGTHS OF ROOM TO SHOVE. SHOVED BACK 2 CARS, MADE CUT, CLEARED ROAD CROSSING, STOPPED AND MADE 2ND CUT, THEN GAVE 'OK' TO PULL OUT BUTTRAIN WOULD NOT MOVE.  INVESTIGATION DETERMINED LATERAL FORCES CAUSED WHEN EXCESSIVE POWER AXLES USED FOR REVERSE MOVEMENT. FORCE CAUSE SOUTH RAIL TO ROLL DERAILING TOTAL OF 6 AUTO RACKS.

D661407-d-06-13-07-ABS.Narrative: TUSCALOOSA TURN WESTBOUND FROM REFORM TO ARTESIA TO INTERCHANGE WITH KCS WAS COMING OFF THE TENN-TOMWATERWAY NEW RIVER BRIDGE DOWNHILL INTO A BOTTOM AREA. ENGINEER STATES TRAIN SPEED WENT TO 12-MPH (10 MPH SPEED LIMIT ON SUBDIVISION) AND HE WENT INTO DYNAMIC BRAKING TO CONTROL SPEED. WENT TO NOTCH3 ON DYNAMICS FOR APPROX. 10 SECONDS, AND THEN OUT NOTCH 4-5-6. SPEED SLOWED TO 10 MPH; ENGINEER EASED OFF DYNAMICS BACK TO NOTCH 3. HE THEN EASED INTO POWER AND STARTED PULLING TO GET TRAIN OUT OF BOTTOM AREA. AT THIS POINT HE WAS CONTACTED BY KCS JOB 111 TO DRAG FEET AND KEEP APPROACHING WHILE THEY CLEARED UP. ENGINEER SLOWED TO 7-8 MPH. AND AS HEAD END PASSED MP 9.0 TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY. CONDUCTOR WALKED TRAIN AND FOUND FIVE CARS DERAILED OVER THE GTRA SWITCH. ALL FIVE CARS UPRIGHT, ANDNO HAZMAT INVOLVED. SWITCH TORE OUT, PLUS APPROX. 150 FEET OF TRACK. CREW NOTIFIED KCS TRAINMASER, ABS TRAINMASTER, AND KCS DISPATCHER. LEAD LOCOMOTIVE DOWNLOAD PERFORMED AT ARTESIA BY ABS TRAINMASTER. REPORT REVIEWED BY WATCO GULF REGION DIRECTOR OF SAFETY AND TRAINING. DOWNLOAD REPORT SHOWS PROPERTRAIN HANDLING AND THIS NOT BEING A CONTRIBUTING FACTOR TO THE DERAILMENT. ROADMASTER PERFORMED MEASUREMENTS AT 20 STATIONS UP TO P.O.D NOTED TWO DEFECTS IN CROSS-LEVEL. ABS ROADMASTER AND ABS TRAINMASTER RETURNED TO P.O.D SITE THIS MORNING TO GATHER ADDITIONAL MEASUREMENTS; TRACK CREWS WERE ALREADY REPAIRING TRACK AT THIS LOCATION. ALL CARS INVOLVED IN DERAILMENT RERAILED AND SENT TO ARTESIA. TR

201885-d-06-03-07-SOO.Accident Cause: Kicking or dropping cars, inadequate precautions
201885-d-06-03-07-SOO.Narrative: HR12 CREW WAS WORKING & FBYM WAS PROTECTING AN ON-TRACK WEED SPRAY TRUCK WHILE IT WORKED WITHIN THECONFINES OF THE TRFALLS YARD. WEED SPRAY TRUCK ENTERED TRFALLS YARD & RECEIVED PERMISSIION TO SPRAYTHE MT&#7 TRACK. ONCE FINISHED, RECEIVED SUBSEQUENT PERMISSION TO SPRAY TRACK #1&#2 AS HR12 HAD JUSTCLEARED #1 TRACK OFF & WERE SITTING IN FRONT OF THE DEPOT WITH 13 CARS FOR THE WAYFREIGHT & 2 NORTHCARS. THE CONDUCTOR & TRAINMAN OF HR12 ENTERED THE DEPOT TO CALL THE ACC & ASK ABOUT FUTURE WORK ASSIGNMENT INVOLVING TRAIN 291, LEAVING THE ENGINEER OF HR12 ON THE LOCOMOTIVE. AS THE CONDUCTOR & TRAINMAN WALKED TO THE DEPOT THEY DISCUSSED THE LAST MOVE OF THE DAY WOULD BE TO KICK 2 CARS INTO # 1 TRACK & PLACE THE FINISHED WAYFREIGHT ON TOP OF THE CARS THEY WOULD KICK INTO THE SAME TRACK. ONCE THE SPRAY TRUCK FINISHED - ACCOUNT SPRAY WAS EMPTY, WEED SPRAY ANNOUNCED TO THE FBYM, VIA RADIO, THATHE WAS HEADING TO OLD #8  & WOULD TAKE OFF THERE AT A CROSSING. THE HR12'S CONDUCTOR LEFT THE DEPOT& WALKED TO #1 TRACK SWITCH LEAVING THE TRAINMAN IN THE DEPOT TO THE USE THE WASHROOM. HE SAW THE WEED TRUCK WAS FAR DOWN THE LEAD & CLEAR OF #1 TRACK & MISTAKENLY LINED #1 TRACK SWITCH FOR THE LEAD INSTEAD OF #1 TRACK. OP060107OK-d-06-01-07-WTJR.Reporting Railroad Name: WICHITA, TILLMAN & JACKSON RAILWAY COMPANY, INC.
OP060107OK-d-06-01-07-WTJR.Maintenance Railroad Name: WICHITA, TILLMAN & JACKSON RAILWAY COMPANY, INC.
OP060107OK-d-06-01-07-WTJR.Narrative: ON 6/01/07 AT 11:20 A.M., THE WTJ4451E CREW WAS PREPARING TO SWITCH THE GRANDFIELD SIDING.  THE CONDUCTOR LINED THE WEST SIDING SWITCH AND REMOVED THE DERAIL.  THE TRAIN WITH 24 LOADED CARS AND 1 EMPTY CAR HEADED EAST INTO THE WEST END OF THE SIDING TO MAKE A JOINT ON 25 MORE EMPTY CARS THAT WERE ALREADY IN THE SIDING.  THE CREW BEGAN SHOVING THE CARS EASTWARD, AT APPROXIMATELY 3-4 MPH OUT OF THESIDING.  THEY HAD SHOVED APPROXIMATELY 9 CARS OUT WHEN THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY. ALL MOVEMENT STOPPED AND THE CONDUCTOR WENT TO FIND THE PROBLEM.  THE 10TH LOAD FROM THE LEAD END HAD SPLIT THE SWITCH WITH THE EAST TRUCK CAUSING THE EAST TRUCK TO TRAVEL DOWN THE MAIN AND THE WEST TRUCK WITH THENEXT 2.5 CARS TO TRAVEL DOWN THE SIDING.  WHEN CAR NUMBER CAGX 1672 SPLIT THE SWITCH IT CAUSED THE BRAKE CUT OUT VALVE  TO BREAK WHICH CAUSED THE TRAIN TO GO INTO `EMERGENCY`.  IT WAS NOTED THAT THE CONDUCTOR WAS PROTECTING THE CROSSING DURING THIS MOVE.  IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THREE OF THE CARS WERE OVERLOADED BY THE CUSTOMER.
